visualization_prompt: Generate a treemap showing hierarchical value distribution using size encoding and sequential color scaling
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 7 hierarchical categories with two numerical variables: value (size encoding) and colorValue (intensity encoding). Synthetic data follows a Pareto distribution (μ=14.29M, σ=8.2M) with artificial market size constraints, simulating real-world business segmentation. The treemap employs Cairo's pre-attentive processing principles through area-size correlation and color intensity, while maintaining Tufte's data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines. Color progression from white (minimum) to red (maximum) creates immediate value perception, supported by D3-formatted monetary labels. Spatial grouping follows squarified algorithm for optimal aspect ratios, enhancing pattern recognition of dominant market segments.
